documents.title: InComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration  - 2025/12/08 09:27 EST - Notes by Gemini
documents.content:
Ôªøüìù Notes

Dec 8, 2025

InComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration 

Invited Laura Titherington Taylor Phelan April Dunham Elysa Viti pmccabe@incomm.com Nikita Gorshkov solutionsconsulting@incomm.com ovicente@incomm.com Scott Silver Amy Alpert Elaine Tobin Aniva Lu Phillip Pidoux-Koronya Jacob Gabiam

Attachments InComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration  

Meeting records Transcript 





Summary

Laura Titherington, Jacob Gabiam - InComm, Nikita Gorshkov, Oliver Vicente, Phillip Pidoux-Koronya, and Elaine Tobin, among others, discussed the integration process and roles for HelloFresh‚Äôs new retail gift card program with InComm, covering the transferred value activation process, value management, and the use of PINs for redemption. Key technical and business requirements were debated, including InComm's ability to create custom-prefixed PINs, the data available in reporting for analytics (such as merchant name and location), and error handling with specific timeout thresholds and retry/cancel recommendations for "get status" and "redeem" requests. Participants also addressed the scope of integration, noting the preference for a variable load product from Elysa Viti and the need to finalize economics, particularly for the Costco program and the creation of separate or combined Canadian and US contracts, with Laura Titherington agreeing to inquire about a single North American agreement to simplify legal review for Elaine Tobin.





Details

Notes Length: Standard

* Meeting Setup and Introductions Laura Titherington addressed initial technical issues with Jacob Gabiam - InComm's audio connection (00:00:00). After resolving the audio problem, Laura Titherington stated that the purpose of the call was to discuss the transferred value integration and introduced Jacob Gabiam - InComm, who would answer questions, and Nikita Gorshkov, who would lead the discussion (00:01:25). A round of introductions followed, with attendees including Nikita Gorshkov (leading new ventures at HelloFresh) (00:02:29), Jacob Gabiam - InComm (Solutions Consultant at InComm) (00:03:29), Laura Titherington (Business Development for InComm Canada) (00:02:29), Oliver Vicente (Lead Channel Manager at InComm), Phillip Pidoux-Koronya (Director of Account Management at InComm Canada) (00:03:29), and Elaine Tobin (running gift cards and flyers for HelloFresh US/Factor) (00:04:36).

* Integration Process and Roles Jacob Gabiam - InComm outlined the steps for the integration, explaining that they would gather requirements and then send them out for PM assignment, with Oliver Vicente providing additional support until a Project Manager is assigned (00:03:29). Phillip Pidoux-Koronya clarified that their team will manage the relationship with HelloFresh, launch the product, and manage the program going forward after Laura Titherington hands off the contract. Elaine Tobin noted that HelloFresh is working as a North America unit to scope out and onboard with InComm for a new retail gift card program (00:04:36).

* Transferred Value Gift Card Activation Jacob Gabiam - InComm described the transferred value process for physical gift cards, where HelloFresh is not involved in the initial activation (00:05:38). The process involves the retailer scanning the IAB barcode, which InComm uses to mark the card as active for the requested amount. The consumer then uses the PIN on the back of the card to send a request to InComm via HelloFresh to validate the PIN and purchase; upon success, HelloFresh sends a redemption request, transferring the value. Nikita Gorshkov confirmed that the verification h



though um and see see what they if there's an opportunity to do a North American agreement for this. I I'm just not hopeful because they it hasn't been done in the past.

 

 

00:41:01

 

Elysa Viti: Okay. Like we're okay to have two different so it just like the main portion of the MSA usually is the same for both North um both countries.

Laura Titherington: Totally understand. Not typically how we do it. I will I will ask the question though.

Elysa Viti: Okay. Yeah. See if what your team can do. If not, like you said, if there was a red line version, you guys can provide. We just don't want that much. We don't want to create too much work for a procurement team, unnecessary extra work. Uh, and we don't want the US to have to launch a lot later than Canada.

Laura Titherington: Yeah.

Elysa Viti: We'd like to launch like similar timelines.

Elaine Tobin: Yeah.

Laura Titherington: Yeah, understood. So, let me take that back. Um, let me take that back. I I don't have an answer right now because I have to ask

Elysa Viti: Okay. All right.

Elaine Tobin: Yeah, I think the other thing of note is like given this request is going in after December 1st, I know our legal team isn't even going to like be able to review and finalize anything until like January. I think anything that we need signed off and reviewed the end of year was due a week ago. So like that's already setting our team back. If that means like Canada won't get finalized until sometime in January, then how long will it take for us, you know? So I think in terms of us like getting business case resourcing like US is just a much higher spend market. So we kind of need to be running in tandem for things to move on the Canadian side.

Laura Titherington: No problem. Let me see what we can do on our side.

Elaine Tobin: Okay.

Laura Titherington: All right.

Elysa Viti: Okay, we'll wait for the contract from you, Laura, and then if we have any questions.

Laura Titherington: Good. Yeah. So, I may hold on that until I get the answer of because there's no point in sending and unless, you know, because right now it as it stands, it's just a Canadian contract.

Elysa Viti: Yeah. Yeah. Okay, great. Awesome.

Elaine Tobin: Thank you.

 

 

Transcription ended after 00:43:13





This editable transcript was computer generated and might contain errors. People can also change the text after it was created.

Summary



Prateek Jajoo experienced a Confluence page access issue, which was  

resolved by Nikita Gorshkov granting access to anonymous users, who also  

clarified the meeting's purpose is for Prateek Jajoo's personal  

development, unblocking, and issue escalation, asking them to manage ETAs  

for the login page and app documentation. Prateek Jajoo updated on  

prioritizing login page features like text box visibility and language  

enhancement for conversion before Katrina's absence, seeking reviews from  

Nikita Gorshkov and Laura Doas this week, and also discussed deprioritizing  

social logins while raising concerns about the lack of recipe selection  

transparency on the checkout page, which Nikita Gorshkov agreed to test if  

inexpensive. Additionally, Prateek Jajoo sought clarity on the design  

review process with Laura Doas, with Nikita Gorshkov advising to consult  

Maria about the TPT experience preview or set up a separate small design  

review.





Suggested next steps





Prateek Jajoo will manage Nikita Gorshkov's expectations regarding the ETA  

for the plan and documents related to the login page and the app.



Prateek Jajoo will catch up with the PM who has more information on social  

login and include the reasons fo



e  

payment or checkout page by checking if the information is available and if  

there are customer complaints related to a lack of transparency.



Prateek Jajoo will check with Maria regarding the TPT experience preview or  

set up a small design review with Laurand Dovas to get feedback on the  

design changes.



Prateek Jajoo will get feedback from Doas today and, if concrete and  

aligned, will set up 30 minutes to socialize the design.



Prateek Jajoo will check again for access to the groups needed, after  

getting access to the new tribe new in Slide page.



Prateek Jajoo will raise a support request if the confluence page access  

issue is not resolved.

Summary



Nikita Gorshkov and Beatrice Dimarucut discussed "charge at checkout"  

refunds, noting that a week is too long for the process and that tracking  

refunded customers separately may be necessary, and they agreed to consult  

with Kag to clarify how refunds and cancellations are individually tracked  

in the AL system for paid orders. Nikita Gorshkov is introducing Beatrice  

Dimarucut to the Spur founders, whose competitive analysis tool addresses  

tracking and comparing flows to an ideal state, and they have financial  

approval to procure them as a supplier. Furthermore, Nikita Gorshkov is  

opening a CS5 role for Beatrice Dimarucut to mentor, providing career  

development and shoring up work with Yuri following Dio's departure, and  

assured Beatrice Dimarucut that potential resistance from Annie would be  

minimal due to the defined headcount structure and involvement of key  

people like John, Yuri, Seb, Alex, DA, and external folks from payments and  

customer care.





Suggested next steps





Beatrice Dimarucut will summarize the owl issues for Nikita Gorshkov.



Nikita Gorshkov will formalize the career development plan for Beatrice  

Dimarucut.



Nikita Gorshkov will create the promo case for the new headcount and talk  

with Jamba about the candidate to open the CS5 role.



The group will ask Kag if refunds and cancelled are individually tracked.

### EMAIL: HelloFresh US 2025-W47 Recipe Report
ID: 19afee2ea4608421
From: "'Rachel LeMier' via Recipe Survey Results" <recipe-survey-results@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi team,





HelloFresh 2025 Week 47 resulted in an overall menu score of 3.41 (-0.09 target

score of 3.50, -0.10 vs planned menu score of 3.51).





CPI Commentary: Scores this week were still greatly impacted by the

broccoli shortage with nearly 20% of all comments received mentioning

missing broccoli. Other recipes that missed included: Meatloaf a la mom

(commentary that gravy recipe was bad), super-quick market recipes

(currently being addressed by product team) and 2 recipes for side dishes

that ran as Thanksgiving specials.





Please see our full report

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mVR6C-x_UMmuY9lgn3VC0N-SdEnfhMcwM2eX9sMpse0/edit?gid=389153776#gid=389153776>

for

in-depth WoW views.





Weekly Call-Outs:



   - SKU Launches:

      - Falafel, Traditional - 10 Piece (pc), slot 20

   - *Quality*

      - R31 - steak was tough and fatty - DC TI: 28/252 | DC NJ: 24/252 |

      DC NW: 4/252; demand was 9.3 suggesting the concept is appealing but the

      meat quality was a detractor from overall score







Recipe of the Week:



Cheesy Smashed Burgers, Demand 6.6 and RS 3.70; L2 "DELICIOUS! Hands down

one of my favorites!"

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúNikita / Beatrice‚Äù Dec 8, 2025
ID: 19afee2babd168dc
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúNikita / Beatrice‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 8, 2025, 5:53 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Nikita Gorshkov outlined a plan to include a banner suggesting users try  

the marketplace beta for meat, featuring a one-off box for delivery with  

express checkout, to be included in the next delivery of dashboards. The  

team, including Beatrice Dimarucut and Nikita Gorshkov, discussed the  

technical implementation of one-time purchases (OTP) for active customers,  

weighing the ease of transferring addresses and choosing between using a  

proper endpoint or a redirect to Shopify. The main talking points focused  

on enabling OTP for active customers due to its low cost and potential  

revenue, which Beatrice Dimarucut agreed to move forward with using minimal  

UI work and a redirect to a plans page, pending confirmation with Alex.





Suggested next steps





Beatrice Dimarucut will clarify with Alex whether it will be easier to use  

the proper endpoint for the OTP flow and confirm the required work to link  

it with different products, such as occasion or preset boxes.



Beatrice Dimarucut will determine where to place the minimal UI work to  

expose the OTP entry point in the subscription flow and redirect users back  

to a plans page with the OTP option.



Nikita Gorshkov and Beatrice Dimarucut will work on seeing and getting  

feedback from customers.

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúInComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration ‚Äù Dec 8, 2025
ID: 19afe8a6532a3680
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúInComm / HelloFresh Tech Integration ‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 8, 2025, 4:16 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Laura Titherington, Jacob Gabiam - InComm, Nikita Gorshkov, Oliver Vicente,  

Phillip Pidoux-Koronya, and Elaine Tobin, among others, discussed the  

integration process and roles for HelloFresh's new retail gift card program  

with InComm, covering the transferred value activation process, value  

management, and the use of PINs for redemption. Key technical and business  

requirements were debated, including InComm's ability to create  

custom-prefixed PINs, the data available in reporting for analytics (such  

as merchant name and location), and error handling with specific timeout  

thresholds and retry/cancel recommendations for "get status" and "redeem"  

requests. Participants also addressed the scope of integration, noting the  

preference for a variable load product from Elysa Viti and the need to  

finalize economics, particularly for the Costco program and the creation of  

separate or combined Canadian and US contracts, with Laura Titherington  

agreeing to inquire about a single North American agreement to simplify  

legal review for Elaine Tobin.





Suggested next steps





Laura Titherington will review the agreement and send it over as a draft to  

Elysa Viti and Aniva Lu today.



Laura Titherington will inquire about the level of interest from Walmart in  

working with HelloFresh on the gift card program for the 2026 launch.



Elysa Viti and Aniva Lu will go back with the analytics team after the call  

to figure out the pin requirements, including any prefix, and let Jacob  

Gabiam - InComm know.



Jacob Gabiam - InComm will send a quick recap email after the meeting and  

pinpoint where to find the list of response codes that are applicable to  

the transferred value integration.



Laura Titherington will follow up with the HelloFresh team regarding a  

potential North American agreement or a red line version of the contract  

and send the Canadian contract for their review.

Format: NGO-style bullets, structured sections

## JIRA UPDATES (-24h)
